DOC.brief_title: Structured Treatment Interruption HIV Patients With Virologic Failure
DOC.detailed_description: To prospectively determine virologic impact switch treatment-experienced HIV-infected patient virologic failure salvage regimen without 12 week STI prior switch . Hypothesis : By withdraw ARV drug pressure , resistant HIV virus revert wild-type . In treatment-experienced HIV patient experience virologic failure , STI prior start salvage regimen result improve virologic response prolong vral suppression compare immediate switch new regime . Interventions : Immediate Switch Salvage Therapy : Patients randomize control arm switch immediately salvage regimen use information treatment history genotype result . Structured Treatment Interruption : Patients randomize STI arm present regimen stop 12 week genotype repeat 12th week . A salvage regimen start week 12 use information treatment history baseline genotype result .
DOC.criteria: Age > 18 year . On therapy triple ARV include protease inhibitor and/or nonnucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor past 3 month change agent combination past 14 day . Virologic failure combination define plasma HIV RNA > 1000 copies/mL measure 2 occasion least 4 week apart . HIV RNA < 500,000 copies/mL . CD4 cell count must > 50/mm3 Patients must present history opportunistic infection acute illness require treatment within precede 30 day . The patient least two new ARV available base history , least two new agent include new salvage regimen . Active substance abuse would interfere patient 's ability participate trial , declare noncompliance . Pregnancy breast feed .
